intro: Pleuranthodium biligulatum, commonly known as the two-lobed pleuranthodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
